name: Hilton Garden Inn Seattle North / Everett

reviews.text: Stayed in Hilton Garden Inn for 5 nights. Since it is Hilton I expected more however rooms are very clean, bathroom nice (shower could be better) with brand washing stuff. Bed was very comfortable. I slept excellent. You have a view from the room on a Payne Field runway full of different plane models. Breakfast was basic but tasty and tailored to your request. Service was nice but not too engaged.
reviews.title: Good hotel - expected more

reviews.text: Hotel is located in front of the Boeing Center so you have really a 1 min walk to one of the top attractions of the region. You need a car/taxi to get to the hotel. Except for Boeing there is not much around. If you have car Seattle is just around 1 h drive. I enjoyed my stay.
reviews.title: Comfy bed, quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For being right across from Paine Field I had a pretty good night's sleep. Cool view of the runway and new planes all lined up at night. Spa tub in room was nice, plenty of cozy towels and the bed was comfortable. We were only here one night but it was quiet and pleasant. Did not eat here but good food not too far away down by the ferry terminal at the Diamond Knot Pizza Place (NOT the alehouse) or at Arnies/Ivars for seafood. Not the spot to go for a romantic weekend but was relaxing.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.text: We spent two nights as it was conveniently located next to the Future of Flight and the Boeing plant tour. The room was ideal with a view across the Payne Field runway to the massive Boeing complex. The room was well appointed with comfortable bed and extremely quiet noting its proximity to the airport. The meals were totally unacceptable. Example: the fish of the fish and chips was tough, rubbery in texture. The restaurant was grossly understaffed at dinner and breakfast. The server did her level best in a pleasing manner in an impossible situation.
reviews.title: Good Experience

reviews.text: This hotel is located right next to Boeing Field. The hotel was very clean and the staff were great. We even got a welcome note in our room from the housekeeper and a thank you note the next day when we left her a tip. We did take out from the restaurant and the salad ordered was huge and well loaded with ingredients rather than typical salads with lettuce and not much else. The breakfast was okay, nothing great. It was complimentary with our room, but I am not sure it was worth paying for. If planes excite you, the odd number rooms face Boeing Field and if you are lucky, you might catch the new planes doing test runs. Hotel is also very close to restaurants in Mukilteo right on the water.
reviews.title: Comfortable, competent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel for 3 nights after the rental house we had near Bellingham failed miserably to live up to expectations and online descriptions.
reviews.title: Front desk came to our rescue!

reviews.text: However when we arrived, there was no trace of the reservation! After much system searching, we eventually realised that infact we had arrived a day early - so this was totally our mistake! Jovinda on reception immediately took control. I knew the hotel was going to be busy that weekend but she found us a King room (our original request) overlooking Paine Field and the Museum of Flight. All this was done with a smile. She also gave us breakfast vouchers and botttles of water and sent us on our way as quickly and smoothly as possible - she really was a star.
reviews.title: It didn,t start well......

reviews.text: The room was on the second floor and over the pool but we neither heard any noise or smelled any chlorine. The view from the room was very interesting due to the planes arriving and taking off at Boeing. There was some aircraft noise (the big fat Dreamlifter in particular) but nothing that was intrusive or disturbing. The bed was very comfortable - lovely linen and large bath towels too. Bathroom is in the centre of the suite - it was clean and with a spacious vanity area around the sink. Shampoos, soaps and mouthwash were all replenished daily. There is also a handy fridge and microwave in the room with a small shop downstairs selling a limited range of ready meals if needed.
reviews.title: No rooms even with a reservation

reviews.text: Breakfast was fine - quite basic but the cooked to order omelettes were nice - I had mushroom and cheese. It was hot, freshly made and satifsying. The cost of the cooked breakfast option is $9.95 per day - I thought this was pretty good value when compared to the average Hilton continental breakfast buffet which is around $16. There was also a waffle maker, fruit, cereals incl hot oatmeal and toppings, yogurts, pastries, choice of juice, teas (including green) and coffee. Basically everthing you need to get your started for the day.
reviews.title: Great location, nice service
neat location
reviews.text: Didn't use the gym, pool, business centre or laundry but they all looked clean and well stocked/maintained. In fact the whole hotel looks pretty new and fresh.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picked this hotel from previous visitors' many favorable comments on your review site. Our stay was one of our most comfortable and pleasant hotel experiences ever. Absolutely no complaints! Very friendly and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Exceptionally pleasant

reviews.text: Came to Hilton Garden Inn Seattle North on a Friday for a visit to the Trip Advisor ® Certificate of Excellence winning Future of Flight Museum, the Collings Foundation B-17 ride and the subsequent Saturday Flying Heritage Collection American Airpower Fly Day... very happy I did, got a lot of value for money for an avgeek vacation. The service was great, the sleep was legendary, the food tasted good and I was treated right.
reviews.title: Best value for money for avgeeks...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: See I came in off of a Skagit Transit County Connector + taxi connection to the hotel and was allowed to stash my bag until I could check into a suite. As documented in the photos, the suite was rather spacious and very clean. I had access to a microwave, coffee machine, refrigerator and a bathroom plus if I choose a nice desk.
reviews.title: Surprisingly quiet and comfortable

reviews.text: Really, truly appreciate the great service from the complimentary shuttle from the hotel to Historic Flight for my B-17 ride. Since the comms to the shuttle to return me were fumbled and I had to wait, I received a complimentary fish & chips dinner. The fish was okay, the fries/chips were great as was the service in the hotel restaurant.
reviews.title: Excellent spot and superb staff!

reviews.text: After more photo taking and a stop into the business center (no fee to use their computer to use the Internet briefly), I went up to my suite for the evening. The view from the hotel of the Boeing flightline and the Future of Flight was amazing. The adjustable sleep was so good my cell phone alarm didn't wake me, only the hotel wake-up call service (free) did eight plus hours later.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good service, great place for Boeing visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we did not get to visit Future of Flight. We were on our way home after wonderful vacation,.
reviews.title: new, great mattresses, next to Future of Flight exhibit

reviews.text: Hilton has hit the mark with nice furnishings, friendly hotel staff, great mattresses. Everything
reviews.title: On the Boeing runway - well almost
Not up to Hilton standards
reviews.text: clean and new. They now have a restaurant with a limited selection, and only the bartender to serve dinners. Service very slow. However, we were exhausted after Vancouver traffic, and it was great to not have to leave the hotel for dinner. Prices were high for the entrees, but both the chicken and steak were well prepared and very tasty. Yummy cookies in the hotel lobby.
Wifi did not work on either of their two systems. Luckily I also have 3G.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: If you want to look a planes this is the hotel to choose.
reviews.title: Can't ask for much more than this

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Seattle North / Everett Hotel
